Seeing this into vtune would then be the next step.

```
[microbenchmarks] Performance differences noted:
Benchmark                                        cpu_time    real_time
-----------------------------------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_HpackEncoderEncodeHeader<EmptyBatch>/1/16384  -11%        -11%
```
I agree. I will post data as soon as I can get to my desk this week

Looks like this greatly reduced the time spent on GRPC_SLICE_MALLOC (and thus begin_frame has fallen from 1st to under 10th). But slice_buffer_add_indexed is still doing an extra copy on the line:
```
sb->slices[out] = s;
```

Before:
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6148140/39730149-cc5c2f3e-5214-11e8-99d4-f270c451569e.png)

After:
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6148140/39730150-d0c24a18-5214-11e8-975a-4eb145613ed7.png)

Is `grpc_slice_buffer_add_indexed_internal` inlined ?

Also, it's looking like we've pushed a lot of the time to this one function. Which is good in the sense we now have a heavy weight function to look at for optimization.
